alert.note: Alert for Hawaii in Hawaii (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 17 at 5:12PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM HST THIS EVENING FOR THE ISLAND OF HAWAII IN HAWAII COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...The island of Hawaii in Hawaii County. * WHEN...Until 815 PM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 510 PM HST, radar indicated heavy rain over Kau slopes above highway 11 between mile markers 44 and 70. Rain was falling at a rate of 1 to 2 inches per hour. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Punaluu Beach, Pahala, Kawa Flats, Wood Valley, Naalehu, Hawaiian Ocean View, Hawaii Volcanoes National Park, Waiohinu, Discovery Harbour and Hawaii Volcanoes Park Kahuku Unit. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 815 PM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding.
